/guides/the-basics/core-concepts/.s: Before getting started with Synclets, it's helpful to understand a few core concepts that underpin how it all works.

/guides/the-basics/getting-started/.s: This will be an introductory guide to using Synclets in your application.

/guides/the-basics/.s: These guides cover the very basics of Synclets.

/guides/releases/.s: This is a reverse chronological list of the major Synclets releases, with highlighted features.

/guides/.s: This series of guides helps explain the concepts behind Synclets and is designed to complement the more comprehensive [API documentation](/api/synclets/).

/api/the-essentials/configuring-a-syncle.s: The createSynclet function wires the provided components, functions, and options into a Synclet.
The createDataConnector function creates a DataConnector instance.
The createMetaConnector function creates a MetaConnector instance.
The createTransport function creates a Transport instance.

/api/synclets/interfaces/core/synclet/me.s: The getDataConnector method returns the active data connector instance.
The getMetaConnector method returns the active meta connector instance.
The getTransport method returns the transports used for messaging.
The getData method resolves to a read-only snapshot of the data tree.
The getMeta method resolves to a read-only snapshot of the meta tree.
The destroy method tears down the synclet and releases owned resources.
The isStarted method reports whether the synclet is currently running.
The start method initializes connectors and begins processing.
The stop method halts connector activity without destroying state.
The log method writes synclet log entries at the requested level.
The setAtom method writes an Atom at the address and optionally syncs it.
The delAtom method removes an Atom at the address and optionally syncs it.
The sync method triggers synchronization work for the provided address.

/api/synclets/interfaces/core/synclet/.s: The Synclet interface coordinates connectors, transports, lifecycle functions, and sync operations.

/api/synclets/interfaces/core/dataconnec.s: The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The DataConnector interface defines the component that is responsible for storing Atoms.

/api/synclets/interfaces/core/metaconnec.s: The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The MetaConnector interface defines the component that is responsible for storing Timestamps.

/api/synclets/interfaces/core/transport/.s: The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The Transport interface defines the component that is responsible for sending and receiving packets to and from other Synclets.

/api/synclets/functions/core/createsyncl.s: The createSynclet function wires the provided components, functions, and options into a Synclet.

/api/synclets/functions/core/createdatac.s: The createDataConnector function creates a DataConnector instance.

/api/synclets/functions/core/createmetac.s: The createMetaConnector function creates a MetaConnector instance.

/api/synclets/functions/core/createtrans.s: The createTransport function creates a Transport instance.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/synclet/syncl.s: The SyncletImplementations type collects async functions that customize Synclet behavior.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/dataconnector.s: The DataConnectorImplementations type lists the async functions required to read and write Atoms.
The DataConnectorOptimizations type lists optional bulk operations a connector can implement to improve performance.
The Atom type enumerates the scalar values stored at a leaf: string, number, boolean, null, or the UNDEFINED constant magic string.
The Atoms type maps the final part of an address to individual Atom values.
The Data type represents the recursive tree of Atoms and nested maps that make up Synclet data.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/metaconnector.s: The MetaConnectorImplementations type lists the async functions required to read and write Timestamps.
The MetaConnectorOptimizations type lists optional bulk operations a connector can implement to improve performance.
The Meta type mirrors the data tree but holds Timestamp information instead of Atoms.
The Timestamp type stores the serialized string recorded for a change.
The Timestamps type maps the final part of an address to individual Timestamp values.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/transport/tra.s: The TransportImplementations type lists the async connect, disconnect, and sendPacket callbacks a Transport requires to operate.
The TransportOptions type configures transport behaviors such as fragment sizes.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/addre.s: The Address type lists the string segments that locate a node inside a data or meta tree.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/anyad.s: The AnyAddress type unifies all Atom, Timestamp, and parent addresses a Synclet can reference.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/anypa.s: The AnyParentAddress type covers every location that has children (whether Atoms, Timestamps, or other parent nodes).

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/atoma.s: The AtomAddress type narrows an Address to a leaf that stores an Atom at a fixed depth in a data tree.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/atoms.s: The AtomsAddress type targets the parent location that contains a collection of Atoms in a data tree.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/address/times.s: The TimestampAddress type narrows an Address to the leaf that stores a Timestamp at a fixed depth in a meta tree.
The TimestampsAddress type targets the parent node that contains a collection of Timestamps in a meta tree.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/component/syn.s: The SyncletComponents type bundles the optional connector and transport instances supplied to createSynclet.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/constant/rese.s: The Reserved type captures the literal string form of the RESERVED magic string.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/constant/unde.s: The Undefined type reflects the literal string produced by the UNDEFINED magic string.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/context/conte.s: The Context type holds arbitrary metadata that travels with a message.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/core/extrafun.s: The ExtraFunctions type stores host-provided helper functions keyed by name for connector implementations.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/logging/logle.s: The LogLevel type lists the logger methods that can be invoked.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/logging/logge.s: The Logger type describes the optional logging functions a Synclet or its components can use.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/message/hash/.s: The Hash type records the numeric hash used for message verification.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/message/messa.s: The Message type defines the wire-format tuple describing a sync event and its payload.
The MessageNode type represents either a Timestamp, a Timestamp-Atom pair, a hash, or nested message nodes.
The MessageNodes type stores a tuple of child message nodes plus an optional partial marker.
The MessageType type enumerates the allowed message kinds, currently the single value 0.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/message/times.s: The TimestampAndAtom type pairs a Timestamp with the optional Atom value it describes.

/api/synclets/type-aliases/option/syncle.s: The SyncletOptions type configures identifiers and logging for a Synclet instance.

/api/synclets/variables/constant/reserve.s: The RESERVED constant is a magic string used to prefix system-reserved identifiers.

/api/synclets/variables/constant/undefin.s: The UNDEFINED constant is a magic string that encodes an `undefined` value.

/api/synclets/.s: The synclets module documents the core Synclet types, helpers, and factory functions.

/api/utils/functions/utility/gethash/.s: The getHash function produces a Hash for a given string payload.

/api/utils/functions/utility/getpacketfr.s: The getPacketFromParts function encodes a destination and body into a packet string.

/api/utils/functions/utility/getpartsfro.s: The getPartsFromPacket function splits a packet into the destination and body parts.

/api/utils/functions/utility/getuniqueid.s: The getUniqueId function generates a unique ID string of the requested length.

/api/utils/functions/utility/isatom/.s: The isAtom function is a type guard that identifies Atom values.

/api/utils/functions/utility/istimestamp.s: The isTimestamp function is a type guard that identifies Timestamp values.

/api/utils/functions/utility/jsonparse/.s: The jsonParse function parses a JSON string that may have come from jsonString.

/api/utils/functions/utility/jsonstring/.s: The jsonString function converts an unknown value to a normalized JSON string.

/api/utils/.s: The utils module gathers shared helper types for JSON parsing, hashing, and packet encoding.

/api/connector-browser/interfaces/connec.s: The getStorageName method returns the localStorage key namespace.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The _brand property identifies DataConnector instances.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The LocalStorageDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector backed by localStorage.
The getStorageName method returns the sessionStorage key namespace.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The _brand property identifies DataConnector instances.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The SessionStorageDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector backed by sessionStorage.
The getStorageName method returns the localStorage key namespace.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The _brand property identifies MetaConnector instances.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The LocalStorageMetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector backed by localStorage.
The getStorageName method returns the sessionStorage key namespace.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The _brand property identifies MetaConnector instances.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The SessionStorageMetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector backed by sessionStorage.

/api/connector-browser/functions/connect.s: The createLocalStorageDataConnector function creates a LocalStorageDataConnector instance.
The createSessionStorageDataConnector function creates a SessionStorageDataConnector instance.
The createLocalStorageMetaConnector function creates a LocalStorageMetaConnector instance.
The createSessionStorageMetaConnector function creates a SessionStorageMetaConnector instance.

/api/connector-browser/.s: The connector/browser module covers LocalStorage and SessionStorage connector types.

/api/connector-database/type-aliases/opt.s: The DatabaseDataOptions type configures the table and column names used for data storage in a database.
The DatabaseMetaOptions type configures the table and column names used for metadata storage in a database.

/api/connector-database/.s: The connector/database module defines shared option types for SQL-style connectors.

/api/connector-database-pglite/interface.s: The getPglite method returns the underlying PGlite instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The PgliteDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector that wraps a PGlite instance.
The getPglite method returns the underlying PGlite instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The PgliteMetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector that wraps a PGlite instance.

/api/connector-database-pglite/functions.s: The createPgliteDataConnector function creates a PgliteDataConnector with optional table settings.
The createPgliteMetaConnector function creates a PgliteMetaConnector with optional table settings.

/api/connector-database-pglite/.s: The connector/database/pglite module documents connectors backed by the embedded PGlite database.

/api/connector-database-sqlite3/interfac.s: The getDatabase method returns the wrapped sqlite3 Database instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The Sqlite3DataConnector interface describes a DataConnector that wraps a sqlite3 Database.
The getDatabase method returns the wrapped sqlite3 Database instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The Sqlite3MetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector that wraps a sqlite3 Database.

/api/connector-database-sqlite3/function.s: The createSqlite3DataConnector function creates a Sqlite3DataConnector with optional table mapping.
The createSqlite3MetaConnector function creates a Sqlite3MetaConnector with optional table mapping.

/api/connector-database-sqlite3/.s: The connector/database/sqlite3 module describes connectors that persist data in sqlite3.

/api/connector-fs/interfaces/connector/d.s: The getDirectory method returns the directory containing data files.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The DirectoryDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector that stores data in a directory.

/api/connector-fs/interfaces/connector/f.s: The getFile method returns the path to the backing data file.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The FileDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector backed by a single file.

/api/connector-fs/interfaces/connector/d.s: The getDirectory method returns the directory containing metadata files.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The DirectoryMetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector that stores metadata in a directory.

/api/connector-fs/interfaces/connector/f.s: The getFile method returns the path to the backing metadata file.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The FileMetaConnector interface describes a MetaConnector backed by a single file.

/api/connector-fs/functions/connector/cr.s: The createDirectoryDataConnector function creates a DirectoryDataConnector instance.
The createFileDataConnector function creates a FileDataConnector instance.
The createDirectoryMetaConnector function creates a DirectoryMetaConnector instance.
The createFileMetaConnector function creates a FileMetaConnector instance.

/api/connector-fs/.s: The connector/fs module documents file- and directory-backed connector types for Node environments.

/api/connector-memory/functions/connecto.s: The createMemoryDataConnector function creates an in-memory DataConnector for testing or ephemeral state.
The createMemoryMetaConnector function creates an in-memory MetaConnector companion.

/api/connector-memory/.s: The connector/memory module provides volatile connectors for tests, demos, and ephemeral synclets.

/api/connector-tinybase/interfaces/conne.s: The getStore method returns the wrapped TinyBase Store.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The depth property returns the address depth supported by this connector.
The TinyBaseDataConnector interface describes a DataConnector that wraps a TinyBase Store.

/api/connector-tinybase/functions/connec.s: The createTinyBaseDataConnector function creates a TinyBaseDataConnector from an existing Store.

/api/connector-tinybase/.s: The connector/tinybase module describes the adapters that wrap TinyBase stores as connectors.

/api/transport-broadcast-channel/interfa.s: The getChannelName method returns the name of the wrapped BroadcastChannel.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The BroadcastChannelTransport interface describes a Transport that proxies an existing BroadcastChannel.

/api/transport-broadcast-channel/functio.s: The createBroadcastChannelTransport function wraps a BroadcastChannel in a BroadcastChannelTransport implementation.

/api/transport-broadcast-channel/.s: The transport/broadcast-channel module documents BroadcastChannel-based transports for browsers.

/api/transport-memory/functions/transpor.s: The createMemoryTransport function creates an in-memory Transport for local testing or demos.

/api/transport-memory/.s: The transport/memory module covers the in-process transport used for local testing.

/api/transport-ws/interfaces/transport/w.s: The getWebSocket method returns the wrapped WebSocket instance.
The log method logs output through the Synclet logger.
The WsClientTransport interface describes a Transport that proxies an existing WebSocket.

/api/transport-ws/functions/transport/cr.s: The createWsClientTransport function wraps a WebSocket in a WsClientTransport implementation.

/api/transport-ws/type-aliases/transport.s: The WebSocketTypes type unifies browser WebSocket and ws WebSocket implementations.

/api/transport-ws/.s: The transport/ws module documents WebSocket-based transports for browser and Node runtimes.

/api/server-stateless-ws/interfaces/serv.s: The getWebSocketServer method returns the wrapped WebSocketServer instance.
The destroy method shuts down the WebSocketServer and releases resources.
The StatelessWsServer interface describes the minimal API for a stateless WebSocket server wrapper.

/api/server-stateless-ws/functions/serve.s: The createStatelessWsServer function wraps a WebSocketServer to expose the StatelessWsServer interface.

/api/server-stateless-ws/.s: The server/stateless-ws module defines the minimal stateless WebSocket server wrapper types.
